Jasny\HttpMessage\UploadedFile

Value object representing a file uploaded through an HTTP request.

Instances of this interface are considered immutable; all methods that
might change state MUST be implemented such that they retain the internal
state of the current instance and return an instance that contains the
changed state.

    Synopsis

    class UploadedFile implements UploadedFileInterface {

    Hierarchy

    Implements

    • Psr\Http\Message\UploadedFileInterface

    Constants

    Name Value
    ERROR_DESCRIPTIONS

    Members

    protected

    • $assertIsUploadedFile — boolean
      Assert that the file is actually uploaded.
    • $error — int
      The error code associated with this file upload.
    • $key — string
      Post parameter key
    • $name — string
      The original name of the file on the client machine.
    • $size — int
      The size, in bytes, of the uploaded file.
    • $tmpName — string
      The temporary filename of the file in which the uploaded file was stored on the server.
    • $type — string
      The mime type of the file, if the browser provided this information. An example would be "image/gif".

    Methods

    protected

    • assertTmpFile() — Assert that the temp file exists and is an uploaded file
    • getDesc() — Get a description to use for errors, includes the parameter key.
    • isUploadedFile() — Tells whether the file was uploaded via HTTP POST
    • isValidPath() — Check if the path is valid
    • moveUploadedFile() — Moves an uploaded file to a new location
    • rename() — Renames a file or directory

    public

    • __construct() — Class constructor
    • getClientFilename() — Retrieve the filename sent by the client.
    • getClientMediaType() — Retrieve the media type sent by the client.
    • getError() — Retrieve the error associated with the uploaded file.
    • getErrorDescription() — Retrieve the description of the error associated with the uploaded file.
    • getKey() — Get the parameter key Note: This method is not part of PSR-7.
    • getSize() — Retrieve the file size.
    • getStream() — Retrieve a stream representing the uploaded file.
    • moveTo() — Move the uploaded file to a new location.
